title: Set f(0) As the y-coordinate
text: We know that $$x=0$$ in the y-intercept. We can compute f(0) to find the $$y$$ coordinate if y-intercept. What is f(0)?
speech: We know that , x is equal to 0  in the y-intercept. We can compute f(0) to find the  y  coordinate if y-intercept. What is f(0)?

title: Put The Answer Into (x,y)
text: $$f(0)=4\times0^2-20\times0+25=25$$. We get $$x=0$$ and $$y=25$$ for y-intercept. Put together, we have $$(0,25)$$ as y-intercept.
